The audio is shit on this. It fades in and out, pops and echos. I would wait for a better copy unless you just plan on watching this on your computer with no one else.

Video is perfect. Audio is semi-decent. But the movie is certainly watchable, don't know what these other guys are smokin'. But regardless, this has to be one of THE BEST sci-fi movies I've seen in a long time. This isn't like any other sci-fi movie your used to seeing. There aren't any aliens, big space battles, super rail guns, wormholes.. none of that crap. Its all about how one astronaut on the moon mining for helium-3 has to endure on his long 3 year mission. Then something very weird happens and his mission changes very fast.

One last thing.. DON'T WATCH ANY OF THE TRAILERS. They give too much of the plot away.

Watch it now.. your missing a masterpiece.

The V/A ratings on here are meaningless...

Video is good, well above acceptable.

Audio however is utter crap. The music and sound effects are fine, but speech is low and jarring, and changes from low to high all the time. I was about to stop the film several times because I couldn't hear what was said.

Amazing movie!!

for 1.19 gb video is great but the sound jumps at parts of the movie, was still able to make out what was going on though.
Saw this in the theater great movie. Funny plus good acting and music. If you like small sci-fi movies like Sunshine  you'll like this.

The video is good quality but the audio is very poor with constant echo and other artefacts.

A few people here rate the audio as very good or very good for an R5 but there's no reason an R5 should have audio this poor.  It sounds like the ripper really screwed up downmixing from multi-channel to stereo (128Kbps CBR 48KHz), that can produce these kinds of problems.

!! The sound on this rip is really, really messed up. !!  I don't understand how people can give an '8' rating to the audio, when the levels jump all over the place.  What the hell is wrong with you people?  The audio is broken.  That doesn't merit an 8!  Duh!

But the movie is great.  Had I known that the sound was so screwed I would have waited for the actual DVD rip.  That said, this was very well written, very well filmed, and very well directed.  Kudos to everyone involved in making this film.  This should be right up there with one of the best Sci-Fi films of all time.  

It's best to watch this with as few spoilers as possible, because the storyline is awesome.

Space ships with plant habitat dome things get called back to earth where there are no longer plants or animals, their orders are to jettison and nuke the domes. Lead actor guy / conservationist kills crew mates and buggers off on his own with 1 remaining habitat dome. After some time he gets bored and decides to nuke himself anyway, the end.
